commit message:
Merge pull request #830 from sdoward/package_rename

Refactored 2 packages

Use CSS zoom to scale card content

The previous approach relied on a complex search for HTML elements
containing text and the CSS rules to style them. It is much simpler and
more efficient to zoom the entire card (including images) with a single
CSS rule.

The existing card and image scaling preferences were renamed to better
reflect their purpose and moved to a more sensible section of the
preferences screen. This commit will also update the old preferences
on the next version upgrade.
Fix not passing correct import card count

Merge pull request #831 from hssm/card-zoom

Use CSS zoom to scale card content

Merge pull request #832 from hssm/importcount

Fix not passing correct import card count

Decrement timebox label count instead of scheduler rep count

Decrementing the rep count in the scheduler in order to report accurate
rep counts to the user was having an effect on deciding when the next
rep/rev card should be distributed (i.e., the rotation started one card
too late)

Merge pull request #834 from hssm/fixrepcount

Decrement timebox label count instead of scheduler rep count
Fix same-day burying of new card siblings

Merge pull request #835 from hssm/newsiblingbury

Fix same-day burying of new card siblings
Fix cards with queue type 3 not being underlined

Merge pull request #837 from hssm/lrn3underline

Fix cards with queue type 3 not being underlined
Expose 'relative overdueness' ordering for filtered decks

Merge pull request #838 from hssm/reloverdueness

Expose 'relative overdueness' ordering for filtered decks
Fix NPE showing progress bar in ActionBar
Workaround for crash dismissing progress dialog

Don't hold reference to collection in DeckAdapter
